item.description:
Let's end the year with good company, good food and good times at Cafeteria. I've dined here a few times and enjoyed each meal, however this will my first brunch. I'm looking forward to one or two of the following; lamb burger, burger deluxe (topped with fried egg), truffled scrambled eggs or breakfast pizza. What will you have?

Cafeteria website


MBTA:
Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to plan your public transportation route

five (5) minute walk from

Green Line Copley Square

or

Green Line Arlington

or

Orange Line Back Bay

DRIVING DIRECTIONS:
Check out Google to plan your route

PARKING:
Check out Best Parking or POVO or Parking Carma.

Before I list the Reservation Rules, please understand the NO-SHOW policy was established to ensure everyone who wants to join can and it will be fairly and strictly enforced.
I want to assure you I do understand if you've RSVPd YES and you have a sudden change of plans because you're lost, you don't feel well, you have transportation issues, you don't have the money, or you just don't want to be around people. My only request is for you to let me know as soon as possible so we don't worry about you and our reservation is adjusted. As long as you contact me you will not be considered a NO-SHOW.

Rules for Events with Reservations:

If it is less than twenty-fours from the meal and you are not able to attend or are running late, you MUST call or text me at (617) 445-7549.

Please be considerate of your fellow diners time by arriving promptly.

Please bring enough cash to pay for your meal, drinks, tip, and tax.

All RSVPs are on a first reply, first seated basis.

You may only RSVP YES or NO. Maybe isn't an option.

Please RSVP YES only if you are certain you will attend.

If you're not sure you can attend because you have other unconfirmed plans or uncertain transportation, please RSVP NO with a comment.

If brunch is full and you wish to attend, please select WAIT LIST RSVP. When a spot opens, your RSVP will automatically be changed to YES based on the time of your WAIT LIST RSVP.

If your name appears on the event page as a YES after the brunch and you have not attended, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If I change you're RSVP to NO because you haven't replied to final update brunch confirmation email deadline, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If any guests you've RSVPd for NO-SHOW each will count as if you've NO-SHOWED.

If you change your RSVP from a YES to a NO within twenty-four hours of the brunch, it is counted as a NO-SHOW if you do not contact me.

If you are a NO-SHOW for three events with reservations you are removed from the group.

NO-SHOWS impact everyone; from you, who could or has been on the wait list to the organizer as well as the restaurant's who staff based on our reservation.

An email from you explaining your absence is an expected courtesy.

If you are removed and there were extenuating circumstances, please email Tonya about rejoining.

Your feedback is appreciated so please, rate the event and venue by completing surveys afterward.

I will be arrive at 1:30 to welcome you from Cafeteria's bar.
item.how_to_find_us: Ask for Tonya/Meetup reservation or call/text my cell (617) 445 7549

group.name: Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, & Dinner Meetup Group

item.name: Our Last Sunday Brunch of Twenty Ten at Cafeteria
